Authors:
Stephane Welti, Lounis Youcef Khodja , Sylvain Dumez,
Delphine Chaduli, Anne Favel, Regis Courtecuisse, Pierre-Arthur
Moreau
Title:
Cellulariella warnieri (Basidiomycota, Polyporales) and its
doubles
Abstract:
Species of Polyporales with a lamelliform hymenophore were
traditionally classified in the genus Lenzites, until recent
phylogenetic analyses revealed their affinities with various poroid
lineages, leading to the re-classification of most of them.
Nevertheless, the phylogenetic relationships of the lamellate « Lenzites
» warnieri Durieu & Mont. have yet to be resolved. The recent
erection of the new genus Cellulariella Zmitr. & V. Malysheva to
encompass L. warnieri and L. acuta does little to disentangle the
cross-synonymies between lamellate polypores of the Trametes group. To
clarify the phylogenetic position of L. warnieri, we combined molecular
data based on five markers (LSU, ITS, TEF1, RPB1, RPB2) with
morphological features of various collections belonging to the Trametes
clade. In Bayesian phylogenetic reconstructions based on RPB1, RPB2 and
TEF1, L. warnieri has an unresolved position on globally poorly
supported cladograms. Conversely, phylogenetic analyses of the combined
(ITS+LSU) sequences support a monophyletic clade encompassing L.
warnieri and L. acuta, which forms a sister group, within a broader
clade encompassing Leiotrametes, Pycnoporus and the sub-clade T.
ljubarskyi  T. cingulata. These phylogenetic results are also supported
by micromorphological data. Here we redefine the genus Cellulariella
based on: i) the moderate amount of scarcely branched, not flagelliform
binding hyphae in the context, ii) the pointed and fusiform hyphal ends
protruding from the hymenium and iii) a strictly lamelliform (lenzitoid)
hymenophore. Without the use of these characters, the broad
interpretation of Lenzites acuta includes a species belonging not to
Cellulariella but to Leiotrametes: Lenzites tenuis, here combined as
Leiotrametes tenuis, comb. nov. A lectotype was designated for
Cellulariella warneri.
